result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L. KELLY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L. KELLY

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
Counsel waived.
GUILTY plea entered to count 2, disorderly conduct.  Convicted.
State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, bail jumping.  Motion granted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for ten (10) days, under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.
Court costs are waived.
Waiver of Right to Attorney.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights. 
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.
This matter is resolved.  The defendant is requesting a new date in order to get additional information to Attorney Vendetti.
Plea date is set for 04-14-14 at 10:30 a.m.
Minutes

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-09-14 at 3:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Defendant refused to sign.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  
Minutes.

RE:  Bail jumping, on 03-12-14.
Initial appearance is set for 03-31-14 at 2:30 p.m.
